com.yahoo.memory

Class WritableMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.memory.Memory
      • com.yahoo.memory.WritableMemory

  • public abstract class WritableMemory
extends Memory
    Provides read and write primitive and primitive array access to any of the four resources mentioned at the package level.
    Author:
    Lee Rhodes

      • writableMap

        public static WritableMemoryMapHandler writableMap(File file)
                                            throws Exception
        Allocates direct memory used to memory map files for write operations (including those > 2GB).
        Parameters:
        file - the given file to map
        Returns:
        WritableMemoryMapHandler for managing this map
        Throws:
        Exception - file not found or RuntimeException, etc.

      • writableMap

        public static WritableMemoryMapHandler writableMap(File file,
                                                   long fileOffset,
                                                   long capacity)
                                            throws Exception
        Allocates direct memory used to memory map files for write operations (including those > 2GB).
        Parameters:
        file - the given file to map
        fileOffset - the position in the given file
        capacity - the size of the allocated direct memory
        Returns:
        WritableMemoryMapHandler for managing this map
        Throws:
        Exception - file not found or RuntimeException, etc.

      • allocateDirect

        public static WritableMemoryDirectHandler allocateDirect(long capacityBytes)
        Allocates and provides access to capacityBytes directly in native (off-heap) memory leveraging the WritableMemory API. The allocated memory will be 8-byte aligned, but may not be page aligned.

        NOTE: Native/Direct memory acquired using Unsafe may have garbage in it. It is the responsibility of the using class to clear this memory, if required, and to call close() when done.

        Parameters:
        capacityBytes - the size of the desired memory in bytes
        Returns:
        WritableMemoryMapHandler for managing this off-heap resource

      • writableDuplicate

        public abstract WritableMemory writableDuplicate()
        Returns a writable duplicate view of this Memory.
        Returns:
        a writable duplicate view of this Memory

      • writableRegion

        public abstract WritableMemory writableRegion(long offsetBytes,
                                              long capacityBytes)
        Returns a writable region of this WritableMemory
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - the starting offset with respect to this WritableMemory
        capacityBytes - the capacity of the region in bytes
        Returns:
        a writable region of this WritableMemory

      • getAndAddLong

        public abstract long getAndAddLong(long offsetBytes,
                                   long delta)
        Atomically adds the given value to the long located at offsetBytes.
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Memory start
        delta - the amount to add
        Returns:
        the modified value

      • compareAndSwapLong

        public abstract boolean compareAndSwapLong(long offsetBytes,
                                           long expect,
                                           long update)
        Atomically sets the current value at the memory location to the given updated value if and only if the current value == the expected value.
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Memory start
        expect - the expected value
        update - the new value
        Returns:
        true if successful. False return indicates that the current value at the memory location was not equal to the expected value.

      • getAndSetLong

        public abstract long getAndSetLong(long offsetBytes,
                                   long newValue)
        Atomically exchanges the given value with the current value located at offsetBytes.
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Memory start
        newValue - new value
        Returns:
        the previous value

        public abstract Object getArray()

        Returns:
        the primitive backing array, otherwise null.

                               byte bitMask)
        Clears the bits defined by the bitMask
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Memory start.
        bitMask - the bits set to one will be cleared
